sentence: The metabolic processes of all organisms can only take place in very specific physical and chemical environments.
concepts: The metabolic processes of all organisms
very specific physical and chemical environments

sentence: The conditions vary with each organism, and also with whether the chemical processes take place inside the cell or in the interstitial fluid bathing the cells.
concepts: the interstitial fluid bathing the cells

sentence: The best-known homeostatic mechanisms in humans and other mammals are regulators that keep the composition of the extracellular fluid (or the "internal environment") constant, especially with regard to the temperature, pH, osmolality, and the concentrations of sodium, potassium, glucose, carbon dioxide, and oxygen.
concepts: The best - known homeostatic mechanisms in humans and other mammals

regulators that keep the composition of the extracellular fluid ( or the " internal environment " ) constant , especially with regard to the temperature , pH , osmolality , and the concentrations of sodium , potassium , glucose , carbon dioxide , and oxygen
the composition of the extracellular fluid ( or the " internal environment " ) constant , especially with regard
the concentrations of sodium , potassium , glucose , carbon dioxide
the extracellular fluid ( or the " internal environment " )

sentence: However, a great many other homeostatic mechanisms, encompassing many aspects of human physiology, control other entities in the body.
concepts: a great many other homeostatic mechanisms
a great many other homeostatic mechanisms , encompassing many aspects of human physiology , control other entities in the body
human physiology , control other entities in the body
many aspects of human physiology , control other entities in the body

sentence: Where the levels of variables are higher or lower than those needed, they are often prefixed with hyper- and hypo-, respectively such as hyperthermia and hypothermia or hypertension and hypotension.
concepts: hyperthermia and hypothermia or hypertension and hypotension
